main.name: Sound
main.description: An `Sound` plugin based on the HTML5 `<audio>` tag. No Web Audio API here, so it is compatibile with many browsers.

children.name: sounds
children.description: An array containing all SoundInstances af all the sound sthat have been loaded.

children.name: loading
children.description: The number of sounds that are still loading.

children.name: success
children.description: The number of sounds that have successfully been loaded.

children.name: error
children.description: The number of sounds that have errored while loading.

children.name: total
children.description: The total number of sounds. Equal to `sounds.length`.

children.name: container
children.description: The `<div>` element under which all the `<audio>` elements are stored. It has a class of `2D-sound`.

children.name: load
children.description: Add a sound (`<audio>` element) to the Game. Works like `Game.Assets.load()` on the `assets-dom` plugin.

arguments.name: URL
arguments.description: The URL that point to the audio file, or an array of URLs (will be added as individual `<source>` tags).

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: The optional, unique name of this sound, so you can easily play it later on.

children.name: get
children.description: Get the sound with the given name or URL.

arguments.name: URL/name
arguments.description: The name or URL of the sound to get. Used exactly as `Game.assets.load()` on the `assets-dom` plugin.

children.name: play
children.description: Play the sound with given name. This actually just perfomrs a `get()` and executes `.play()` on the result.

arguments.name: name/URL
arguments.description: The name or URL of the sound, as passed to `Game.sound.get()` on the `xhr-assets` plugin.

children.name: pause
children.description: Pause the sound with given name. This actually just perfomrs a `get()` and executes `.pause()` on the result.

arguments.name: name/URL
arguments.description: The name or URL of the sound, as passed to `Game.sound.get()` on the `xhr-assets` plugin.

children.name: stop
children.description: Stop the sound with given name. This actually just perfomrs a `get()` and executes `.stop()` on the result. This sets `currentTime` to `0` on the `<audio>` element. That way, it won't start off where it was paused when you play it again.

arguments.name: name/URL
arguments.description: The name or URL of the sound, as passed to `Game.sound.get()` on the `xhr-assets` plugin.
